project.teaser: In recent decades, new planning paradigms have reshaped cities. Urban regeneration has renovated public spaces, redeveloped city centers, and established innovation districts. Smart cities have implemented technological systems, such as transport management, water and...
project.objective: In recent decades, new planning paradigms have reshaped cities. Urban regeneration has renovated public spaces, redeveloped city centers, and established innovation districts. Smart cities have implemented technological systems, such as transport management, water and contamination monitoring, and energy-efficient buildings. A new sustainable approach, including recycling, renaturalization, and recovery, has emerged in response to the demand for environmental sensitivity in urban planning. These strategies have mainly been applied to wealthy areas to attract tourism and companies, repositioning cities in the global economic framework. However, applying these regeneration strategies, smart systems, and renaturalization processes to deprived areas is crucial. These areas tend to face multiple urban problems, such as pollution, social and cultural issues, lack of services and low-quality built environments, and public spaces, leading to issues related to liveability, functionality, quality of life, social cohesiveness, and physical and mental health. Moreover, there is a growing need for climate change adaptation strategies, which has led to the implementation of Nature Based Solutions (NBS). However, a new pattern is emerging, which considers nature as a stakeholder in itself, beyond the ecosystem services it provides. Innovative technologies such as AI, machine learning, and immersive realities are also emerging, which can enhance the accuracy of information delivery and people engagement. GreenIn Cities aims to develop methodologies and tools for collaborative climate mitigation and adaptation urban planning approaches, specifically for deprived areas, addressing three main challenges: improving societal readiness level and awareness of vulnerable groups, going beyond classical greening and renaturing interventions, and leveraging cutting-edge technologies to enhance co-creation and maximize urban regeneration impacts.
project.title: GreenInCities
project.keywords: greening solutions, NBS, One Health approach, NEB

article.title: A holistic approach to address urban inequality

result.title: SOLUTIONS, PRACTICES and SUPPORT SYSTEMS MERGING NBS and NEB initial catalogue
result.description: D2.4 – SOLUTIONS, PRACTICES and SUPPORT SYSTEMS MERGING NBS and NEB initial catalogue, is the first reported instance of a Living Document including guidelines for solutions’ co-design and implementation.

result.title: GreenInCities Values and Ethics Handbook
result.description: D1.7 – GreenInCities Values and Ethics Handbook [M06– URBANA –PU–R]. Will deliver a handbook aimed at defining the GreenInCities moral and societal values into solutions design, reflecting the fact that solutions designed and implemented go beyond “functionality” to moral and social values such as sustainability and accountability

result.title: GreenInCities LLs Governance initial report
result.description: D3.3 – GreenInCities LLs Governance initial report [M12 /M30–LiU–PU–R] Will provide the initial project framework of principles and mechanisms to operationalize multi-stakeholder governance in Leader and Follower LLs.

result.title: Public green space and built environment requirements framework
result.description: D2.1 – Public green space and built environment requirements framework [M9– ABUD –PU–R], a methodological framework summarizing the main global and European strategies mainly related to sustainability, climate resilience focusing on NbS.

result.title: Innovation management plan
result.description: D1.2 – Innovation management plan [M06– IAAC–PU–R], presenting the project plan for delivering innovation in the project domains.

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Plan
result.description: D8.1 – Dissemination and Communication Plan [M6-IFC, PU, R] a report describing in detail the overarch-ing DCP, including planned actions, online and offline presence, channels, audiences, stakeholders, etc.

result.title: ‘Archeology’ of Hidden Values of Underutilized Historic Industrial Sites in Context of Urban Regeneration and Nature-Based Solutions
POTENTIAL APPLICATIONS OF AI IN BIOPHILIC URBANISM AND NATURE-BASED SOLUTIONS IN CITIES
GreenInCities Sustainable Renaturing Toolbox
result.description: D2.2 – GreenInCities Sustainable Renaturing Toolbox [M9– LAND–PU-R],this report will contain the Methodological frameworks for local conditions quantitative assessment and pre-evaluation frameworks developed in T2.2, comprising two guides: namely one “QUANTITATIVE ASSESSMENT - LOCAL DIAGNOSTIC SYSTEMS” and one “DECISION MAKING SUPPORT SYSTEMS” for to technical experts of the project pilots, for use in the “Co-Analysis” & “Co-Monitoring” and “Co-Design and Implementa-tion” project phases, respectively.

result.title: Data domain protocol for greening innovation
result.description: D1.5 – Data domain protocol for greening innovation [M9– SENS–PU–R], will design a model DMP tem-plate that is re-usable and address key policies, standards, methods and tools needed to GreenInCities and pub-lish data in Open Access.

result.title: A data-driven building thermal zoning algorithm for digital twin-enabled advanced control

details.authors: Lina Morkunaite, Adil Rasheed, Darius Pupeikis, Vangelis Angelakis, Tobias Davidsson

result.title: Initial Toolbox and Methodologies for LLs towards Implementation and Twinning
result.description: D3.1 – Initial Toolbox and Methodologies for LLs towards Implementation and Twinning (updated on M24 to D3.4) will be the project reference document (M12-M24) towards establishing local co-creation activities, per pilot site, with a focus on participation of a broad array of local stakeholders towards giving early input to T5.3 on how the Community of Practice should be organised. The deliverable will therefore comprise two integral parts:o“QUALITATIVE ASSESSMENT - PARTICIPATORY ANALYSIS SYSTEMS” - Methodologies for local condition qualitative assessment dedicated to people, part of the “Co-Analysis” and “Co-Monitoring” Phaseo“CO-CREATION SYSTEMS” - Methodologies for plans and interventions co-design dedicated to people, part of the “Co-Design” Phaseo“CITIZEN SCIENCE TOOLS” – Methodologies for the application of the project Citizen Science Tools

result.title: GreenInCities’ visual identity, website and social media presence
result.description: D8.3 – Green In Cities’ visual identity, website and social media presence [M6-THINGS-PU-OTHER] All chan-nels are active together with the overall visual identity and branding of the project.

result.title: Quality management plan
result.description: D1.6 – Quality management plan [M03– LiU–PU–R] defining the project's quality policies, procedures, crite-ria for- and areas of- application, and roles, responsibilities with respect to quality of outcomes.

result.title: Data management plan - Initial
result.description: D1.4 – Data management plan, will provide an initial DMP with the project framework for guidelines, such as the description of the data and data management tools for accessing and using the data for research purposes. Minor updates will be continuous, incorporating additional small needs, as they arise per pilot. Three more snapshots will be delivered on M18, 36, and 48 as D1.8, D1.9 and D1.10 respectively

result.title: Project management plan
result.description: D1.1 – Project management plan [M03-IAAC–PU–R], describing the governance bodies, the relevant meet-ings, management tools as well the internal rules and procedures relating to or complementing the Grant Agreement and the Consortium Agreement, and including the risk management procedures; Interim and final periodic reports.

result.title: Inclusivity Plan
result.description: D7.4 – Inclusion Plan [42-URBANA-PU-R], will gather and present in a structured way a framework (tools, guidelines, etc) to be followed throughout the project (M6) to guarantee inclusivity, gender equality, sustainability and long-term benefits.

category.title: pollution
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/pollution

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
